page.title: 08OYSTER FARMING AT PYEFLEET
page.content: The oysters produced at Pyefleet are the Colchester Native and the Pacific. They feed on the nutrients brought into the Pyefleet from the surrounding saltings when these are flooded.Native oysters were depleted by disease in 1981 and now can only be bred in disease-free areas.The Colne Oyster Fishing Company breeds Colchester Native oysters in Loch Ryan in Scotland,and brings the young oysters back to the Pyefleet to mature. They are dredged up at 6 years old, hand cleaned of weeds and barnacles, and kept for 2 days in sterile sea water to free them of bacteria.They are sold alive,with their shells firmly closed,for eating except during the breeding season,May to August. Pacific oysters are only matured in the Pyefleet.They do not breed in this country.
